About Us

Jonas Reger
Lead Instructor
Statistics

My name is Jonas and I'm a grad student studying Analytical Statistics. I love math, statistics, and computer science - especially teaching them!:) I will be starting my M.S. Statistics-Analytics degree in the Fall! In addition to working as the Lead Instructor for this class, I also manage and develop the STAT 100 course website and work as a TA in the Statistics Department at UIUC. I was born and raised in Champaign, but I also lived in San Diego for awhile! I enjoy reading, gaming, playing piano, hiking, and talking with friends.

Tamun Hanjra
Assistant Instructor
Psychology

My name is Tamun (tah-min) Hanjra and I am a Junior studying Psychology with a concentration in Behavioral Neuroscience and Child Developmental Psychology. I am from Northern VA, about 30 minutes out of D.C. I loved STAT 100 when I took it and was also a CA for STAT 107 after taking it in it's pilot semester, so I decided to try to get involved with being an Assistant Instructor for this class! Some other facts about me: I am in the Marching Illini Drumline and play the cymbals, so hopefully you can catch me on game days when they hopefully happen again. I have a dog back home whose name is Caspar and I will absolutely show you pictures. I also play the flute, love to read and have been obsessed with Tik Tok for a while now! :)

Karle Flanagan
Advisor
Statistics

Hi everyone! My name is Karle and I'm a statistics instructor. I've always loved math, statistics, and education. Teaching statistics and data science is the perfect job for me since I can help students from many different majors gain an appreciation for all 3.

A few other things about me: I'm a huge Illini fan- I went to school at UIUC, met my husband at UIUC, and now I work at UIUC. U of I is one of my favorite places in the world! I also enjoy spending time outside, playing piano, water skiing, snow skiing, and traveling.

Digital Scholars Data Science is an introduction to topics that intersect between statistics, computation, and real-world applications. This 5-week-long course will be project-driven, which will give students opportunities to analyze real-world datasets and discover the impact of the data. Students will gain an understanding of complex ideas in statistics and computing, and consider the social impact and issues of Data Science such as privacy and design.
